intro: Carum tenerum, commonly known as slender caraway, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. The fruits, which are small and dry, are often used in traditional herbal remedies and as a spice in some cuisines.
